title: U.S. Government Bond Yields Rise After Fed Announcement
sub_head: The Federal Reserve keeps short-term interest rates near zero and indicates it is prepared to raise them at its mid-March gathering
body:
U.S. government bond yields climbed Wednesday after the Federal Reserve signaled plans to begin raising interest rates in March.
The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury note recently traded at 1.849%, according to Tradeweb, from 1.782% at Tuesday’s close. The two-year yield, which often moves with investors’ expectations for central bank policy, was at 1.083%, from 1.025% Tuesday.
